resources.string: The title or content are empty, please be sure to fill them in.
Open audio folder to hear recorded blog dictations

Attached is a backup of the blog drafts. You can open it as text, and you can also open it as a Interactive Draft Tree on the AuBlog web interface at the http://aublog.net/webinterface/view_draft_tree.html on the website.
Really erase your saved drafts? All of your drafts will be lost!
The Text to Speech voice might be annoying for some users, you can search for Loquendo on the Market if you want a nice voice.

If checked the app will use a paired bluetooth headset to record and play audio, if no device is connected it will play through the earpiece of the phone so that the app wont unexpectedly use the speaker.
If a headset is plugged in, by default the app will use the headset to record and play audio
Use In-call Speaker for Audio Playback
If checked the app will play audio through the phone earpiece, rather than through the speaker.
Enables safety hacks for broken devices (Cliq, etc), but causes some visual artifacts. Try this if you have problems.
Use this blogger account to publish your posts by default.
Use the trackball click or directional pad center button to attack.
Displays movement pad and buttons on screen. Suggested for devices without a d-pad or trackball. Requires mulitouch.
EXPERIMENTAL! Tilt the phone left and right to drive the Android around. Good for devices with no trackball or d-pad.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the trackball, d-pad, or optical sensor.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the tilt controls.
Customize keys for phones with hard keyboards.
Sends anonymous statistics to a server to help us make this app more useful and adaptive.
AuBlog was made by Gina Cook and Siddhartha Kattoju, and produced by iLanguage Lab.
Go to the AuBlog web site

Special Thanks to the Montreal Computational Linguistics community, and the other Open Source developers for their work which directly or indirectly contributed to this project. If you like AuBlog share us with your friends!

Portions of this AuBlog are modifications based on work created and shared by Open Source developers and used according to terms described in the GNU Lesser License, Apache 2.0 License, the MIT License and the Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution License.
Output various logs to logcat. This option will slow the app down.
Taking you to the Application Settings where you can select AuBlog and "Clear data"...
Starting a new AuBlog in this mode will erase your current AuBlog in progress. Are you sure you want to start a new AuBlog?
This extra feature is still in the lab!

Thanks for downloading AuBlog.

 This is an open source project. If you are interested in how it works, or would like to add your own modules, check out the source at our web site, aublog.net. 
 
 Also note that the app sends anonymous statistics back to a server to detect frequent user functions which should be automated. If youâ€™d rather not allow that, you can turn it off in the settings screen.

Based on your device hardware, the following control scheme has been automatically selected:

%1s

AuBlog supports many different blog configurations. Control options can be changed at any time using the Configure Controls button in Options.

Are you ok with the control system selected above, or would you like to set up your control settings manually now?
Trackball / Trackpad - Sensitivity can be adjusted in Options.
Keyboard / Pad - Key mappings can be changed in Options.
Tilt - Sensitivity can be adjusted in Options.

This version of AuBlog adds an option for On-Screen Controls for multi-touch devices. Your device supports this new mode, but your options are currently set to Tilt controls. Would you like to try the new On-Screen Controls instead, or stick with Tilt? \nYou can change this setting at any time by choosing Configure Controls under Options.

In this version: Publish to Blogger accounts. HTML markup blog editing, transcribe sentence by sentence dictation using Google Voice and navigate drafts tree. Full data export. Record long dictations. Future versions: speech recognition services for long dictations, publish to podcasts.
A comfortable ride to the end.
